title: The Beacon
text: This is a view of the Peselli Hills in Pembrokeshire, Wales. It depicts the evening of a Strawberry Moon which has just risen over the hills and has produced an eerie light. The navigation lights on the television mast which was situated in the hills added to the haunting atmosphere.....and then some man with a dog on his head and a puppy on his lap came cycling into the scene!

title: Android
text: This work is based on a photo that I took of my granddaughter. We were on a family holiday in Linton, Yorkshire, England, and we'd just finished a barbeque. It was twilight and she had just borrowed her mom's Android mobile phone to play a game and I was captivated by the light.

title: Rest In Peace
text: This painting depicts the otherworldly setting of the Ffynone Falls in Pembrokeshire, Wales. There just happened to be a few people lying around sleeping at the time. Or were they?

title: Ghost of Old Park Hill
text: I recently visited the iconic Park Hill flats in Sheffield, Yorkshire  England, which have now been refurbished. Whilst there the previous life of the building and its tenants was brought to mind. My painting depicts ghostly images of previous residents and their happy memories.

title: One For Sorrow
text: This drawing is of the trig point obelisk on top of Kinver Edge, Staffordshire, England. It depicts a misty Autumn day when the atmosphere was quite melancholic. A Magpie landed on top of the obelisk and I was reminded of the nursery rhyme  One for sorrow, two for joy.....

title: Death
text: This is my one & only acrylic painting. It is a painting of a dead tree in Chances Wood, Kinver, Staffordshire, England. I was taken with its majesty even in death.

title: It's a Halfpenny Green Moon
text: This is a portrait of a lovely lady, Emily. It is based on a photograph taken by her son which was posted on Facebook. I saw it and was taken by the sheer joy it exuded. I asked Emily if I could paint it and she kindly agreed. The photo was taken on an Autumn evening in front of a bonfire. The moon had just come out and Emily was drinking a pint of Halfpenny Green cider. She was very happy.             Emily 1975 - 2026.

title: Big Boy
text: On a trip to Berlin we visited Templehof Airport. There are some hippy allotment gardens on there, the majority of which contain tat & rubbishy so called art installations. The desolation of the place moved me and I just had to take a photo of it. My son-in-law, struck a dramatic pose one day which I also felt was worthy of capturing. I thought the image of Templehof would make a good background for my drawing of him.

title: Home is North
text: This piece is a comment on a couples wish to return to their home in the north of Englamd. It is set in the coastal village of Beesands, Devon, England.

title: Defiled
text: This drawing is a view of the interior of the Neue Nationalgalerie in Berlin. It is the last building designed by renowned german architect Mies van der Rohe to be constructed. The seated man is contemplatinng Mies' courting of the Nazi party in order to get his buildings built to the detriment of anyone else. And  hence his magnificent designs are tainted by this.

title: Thinking of Chris
text: I thought it was about tlme that I did a painting of some friends. These two dear friends obliged. The title is a reference to a Rhea that used to visit their house. They loved it and gave it the nickname Chris (for obvoous reasons). It had recently died hence the contemplative tone of the painting.

title: Rapscallions
text: I saw these two discussing the virtues if the car they were sitting in. I was taken by the light and mood of the scene and just had to paint it.

title: Wanker
text: This is a quick pencil drawing self portrait that I did one evening

title: Sonja
text: This is a very early work that I did when I was 16 or 17 years old. It is a ball point pen drawing of Sonja Kristina who was a member of the prog rock group Curved Air.
